slides.title: Welcome to Famous Scientists
slides.content:
# Introduction to Famous Scientists

Welcome to **Famous Scientists** - the people behind the discoveries!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Pioneers** - Those who founded fields
- **Revolutionaries** - Those who changed everything
- **Modern Heroes** - Recent contributors

> **Fun Fact:** Marie Curie is the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences!

slides.title: Physics Giants
slides.content:
# Physics Giants

## Isaac Newton (1642-1727):
- Laws of motion, gravitation
- Calculus
- Optics

## Albert Einstein (1879-1955):
- Relativity (special and general)
- E = mc^2
- Photoelectric effect

## Marie Curie (1867-1934):
- Radioactivity
- Discovered polonium, radium
- Two Nobel Prizes

## Richard Feynman (1918-1988):
- Quantum electrodynamics
- Nobel Prize 1965
- Great teacher

slides.title: Biology and Medicine
slides.content:
# Biology and Medicine

## Charles Darwin (1809-1882):
- Theory of evolution
- Natural selection
- Origin of Species

## Louis Pasteur (1822-1895):
- Germ theory
- Pasteurization
- Vaccines

## Gregor Mendel (1822-1884):
- Laws of inheritance
- Father of genetics

## Rosalind Franklin (1920-1958):
- X-ray crystallography of DNA
- Key to understanding structure

slides.title: Scientists Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Who is known as the father of genetics?

slides.title: Chemistry and More
slides.content:
# Chemistry and Other Sciences

## Dmitri Mendeleev (1834-1907):
- Periodic table
- Predicted unknown elements

## Nikola Tesla (1856-1943):
- AC electricity
- Induction motor
- Radio pioneer

## Stephen Hawking (1942-2018):
- Black hole radiation
- Popular science books
- A Brief History of Time

## Jane Goodall (1934-):
- Chimpanzee behavior
- Conservation
- 60+ years of research
